Trial_Design.evidence: In random order, each of the drapes was evaluated

Intervention.evidence: compared cutaneous heat loss and skin temperature in volunteers covered with this drape to two conventional surgical drapes

Method_Outcome.evidence: calculated cutaneous heat loss and skin-surface temperatures from 15 area-weighted thermal flux transducers

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: In random order, each of the drapes was evaluated

Result_Outcome.evidence: Under dry conditions, baseline heat loss was 82±14 watts (W) and decreased 30% with a surgical drape ( P <0.001).
